firmware0_90_1.title: Attention Keyboardio Model 100 owners!
firmware0_90_1.description: Firmware before version 0.90.1 contains a bug that leads to data loss and corrupted data saved on the keyboard. If you're already running newer firmware, you can dismiss this warning with the close button.

sanity-check.title: Running environment verification
sanity-check.message: Chrysalis has detected that it is running in an unsupported environment, such as with an Electron version other than the one supported upstream. If you are using Chrysalis through a distribution's package repository, please consider using the official builds instead.

autoUpdate.downloaded: Version {{ version }} downloaded, restart Chrysalis to finish installing

firmwareAutoUpdate.downloaded: Firmware version {{ version }} downloaded, and is available for flashing
firmwareAutoUpdate.error: Error while downloading the new firmware version.
firmwareAutoUpdate.warning: Chrysalis was unable to check for a new firmware version. A newer version may be available online.

cancelPending.title: Discard pending changes?
cancelPending.content: You have unsaved changes. If you proceed, they will be lost.

editor.plugin_unavailable: Your keyboard's firmware does not include support for this feature.
editor.plugin_unavailable_for_macros: This function isn't available in macros

sharing.title: Backup & Restore
sharing.selectLoadFile: Select file to load a layout from
sharing.selectExportFile: Select file to export the layout to

errors.unableToLoad: Unable to load layout from the selected file.
errors.invalidLayoutData: File did not contain valid layout data.

importConfirm.title: Import the selected layout?
importConfirm.contents: This will overwrite your current layout, and any unsaved changes will be lost. Are you sure you want to continue?

overview.help: An overview of the mappings for the currently selected key. To change the shown layer, click on its row.

custom.title: Key code
custom.help: Assign a custom Kaleidoscope key code.
custom.label: Custom key code

secondary.title: Secondary action
secondary.help: When tapped, you get the primary function. When held you get the secondary action.
secondary.help-layerLimit: Due to firmware limitations, shifting to layers above "{{ layer7 }}" is not supported via secondary actions.

colors.title: Colors
colors.help: Set a key's color by clicking the palette below. Use the color picker to adjust the palette.

keypicker.modsHelp: Modifiers to add as you press this key.
keypicker.specialModsHelp: Change how modifiers affect this key.

oneshot.label: Sticky
oneshot.tooltip: Tap to activate for next keypress, hold to act like a regular modifier, double tap to toggle modifier.

topsyturvy.label: Invert Shift
topsyturvy.tooltip: Invert the behavior of the Shift key. (For example, send 'A' when unshifted and 'a' when shifted)

layer.title: Layers and keymaps
layer.help: Keys that let you change layers.

leader.title: Leader
leader.help: Assign Leader keys. To configure this feature, customize the Kaleidoscope sketch file for your keyboard.

cancelStickyKey.tooltip: A dedicated key to cancel sticky keys.

metaStickyKey.tooltip: Makes the next key pressed sticky until tapped again.

activeStickyKey.tooltip: Makes any currently-pressed keys sticky until tapped again.

ledkeys.title: LED control
ledkeys.help: Control your keyboard's LED themes and effects.

macros.title: Macros
macros.help: Assign hardcoded macros built into your firmware to keys.

dynmacros.title: Dynamic Macros
dynmacros.help: Assign and edit dynamic macros to keys.

mousekeys.title: Mouse control
mousekeys.help: Move the mouse with your keyboard

movement.title: Movement
movement.help: Move the mouse with your keyboard

buttons.title: Buttons
buttons.help: Press mouse buttons with your keyboard

warp.title: Warp
warp.help: Zoom your mouse across the screen in a few keypresses

spacecadet.title: SpaceCadet
spacecadet.help: Make left & right 'Shift' act as '(' and ')' when tapped

steno.title: Steno
steno.help: Enable GeminiPR Stenographic input instead of Plover's QWERTY input

tapdance.title: TapDance
tapdance.help: These keys trigger different actions based on the number of times you tap

onlyCustom.warning: Chrysalis no longer supports configurations containing a mix of hardcoded and EEPROM layers. If this is a feature you need, we'd love to hear more about your use case. In most cases, however, we would advise switching to custom layers only, which Chrysalis can do for you. When doing the switch, hardcoded layers will not be used, and the default layer set - if any - will be layer zero.

layernames.out_of_space: Your layer names are {{ overflow }} bytes too long to save to your keyboard.

macros.title: Macro #{{ index }}
macros.out_of_space: Dynamic macros are using too much space, please free up {{ overflow }} bytes.

steps.EXPLICIT_REPORT: Do not send a report between steps

chunked_writes.label: Send data in small chunks
chunked_writes.help: As a possible remedy to various communication issues, Chrysalis can send data to the keyboard in smaller chunks. For historical reasons, this is enabled by default. Only turn it off if you know what you're doing, or were asked to by the Chrysalis developers.

main.label: Developer tools
main.description: These preferences primarily aid developers. You may be asked to turn them on, to collect more information about an issue.

verboseLogging.label: Enable verbose logging
verboseLogging.help: Turns on a fair amount of extra logging, useful for debugging only.

console.label: Open the developer console
console.help: The developer console lets you peek inside Chrysalis. Use with care.

mode.label: Download new versions of Chrysalis automatically
mode.help: When enabled, Chrysalis will check for updates on startup, and automatically download new versions.

firmwareMode.label: Download new firmware versions automatically
firmwareMode.help: When enabled, Chrysalis will check for updated firmware files on startup, and automatically download new versions.

oneLayerPerPage.label: Print one layer per page
oneLayerPerPage.help: When enabled, Chrysalis will arrange the layout cards to print one layer per page, rather than as many as fit.

hideUnavailableFeatures.label: Hide features not supported by your keyboard's current firmware
hideUnavailableFeatures.help: When enabled, Chrysalis will hide configuration options for features that your keyboard's firmware doesn't support.

coloredLayoutCards.label: Show colors on layout cards
coloredLayoutCards.help: When enabled, layout cards will show colors in addition to key labels, if available.

host.label: Keyboard layout
host.help: Select the key layout you use on your computer

advanced.label: Advanced Tools
advanced.description: These are dangerous tools, please make sure you know what they do before using any of them.

defaultLayer.label: Default layer
defaultLayer.help: The default layer the keyboard will start up with.

dialog.title: Reset EEPROM to factory defaults?
dialog.contents: This will reset the EEPROM to factory defaults. You will lose all customizations made.

idle.label: Idle time before LEDs turn off
idle.help: Unless disabled, LEDs will turn off after a configured amount of time.

brightness.label: LED Brightness
brightness.help: Adjust the brightness of the LEDs on the keyboard.

autoSave.label: Enable automatically saving the default led mode
autoSave.help: When enabled, whenever the led mode is changed, it gets saved as the default.

default.label: Default led mode
default.help: Select the led mode the keyboard should start up with.

enabled.label: Enable auto shifting
enabled.help: With auto shifting enabled, selected keys will automatically input their shifted variant when held.

timeout.label: Auto shift timeout
timeout.help: Controls how long a key needs to be held before getting the shifted state.

letters.label: Auto shift letter keys
letters.help: Enable auto shifting for letter keys. These only include the letters between A and Z on an US QWERTY layout.

numbers.label: Auto shift number keys
numbers.help: Enable auto shifting for number keys. Does not include the number keys on the numpad.

symbols.label: Auto shift symbols
symbols.help: Enable auto shifting for symbols: -_, =+, [{, ]}, \|, ;:, '", `~, ,<, .>, /?. You may need to turn this on if you are using a language or layout other than US English, if you want to auto-shift letters not covered by the letter auto shift.

arrows.label: Auto shift arrows
arrows.help: Enable auto shifting for the arrow keys.

functions.label: Auto shift function keys
functions.help: Enable auto shifting for the function keys, F1 through F24.

all.label: Auto shift all keys
all.help: Enable auto shifting for all keys, even those that aren't in any of the above categories.

escOneShot.label: Let Escape cancel sticky keys
escOneShot.help: When enabled, "Escape" will cancel sticky keys, otherwise a dedicated cancel key can do so.

warp_grid_size.label: Warp grid size
warp_grid_size.help: Configure the size of the grid used for mouse warping.

init_speed.label: Initial mouse cursor speed
init_speed.help: The higher the value, the faster the initial mouse cursor movement speed.

base_speed.label: Top mouse cursor speed
base_speed.help: The top speed the mouse cursor is allowed to reach.

accel_duration.label: Duration to reach top cursor speed
accel_duration.help: Duration in which the cursor goes from initial to top speed.

scroll_interval.label: Scrolling speed
scroll_interval.help: Time between scroll events. The higher the delay, the slower scrolling is.

timeout.label: Timeout
timeout.help: Time until a sticky key remains active after pressed.

hold_timeout.label: Hold timeout
hold_timeout.help: Sticky keys held longer than this will not enter their sticky state, but will act as normal keys.

auto_mods.label: Automatically make modifiers sticky
auto_mods.help: Turn every modifier on your keymap into Sticky modifiers.

auto_layers.label: Automatically make layer shift keys sticky
auto_layers.help: Turn every layer shift key on your keymap into Sticky layer keys.

stickyness.label: Double tap behaviour
stickyness.help: Select what to do when a sticky key is double tapped in quick succession.
stickyness.enable: Lock in for all sticky keys
stickyness.layers_only: Lock in for layer keys only
stickyness.modifiers_only: Lock in for modifier keys only

mode.label: Enable SpaceCadet shifts
mode.help: When enabled, the left and right shifts on your keyboard will turn into parens when tapped, but remain shifts when held.

timeout.label: Timeout
timeout.help: The number of milliseconds to wait before considering a held SpaceCadet key as shift on its own.

keyboardSelect.noUdev: Chysalis requires udev to be able to scan for devices, but it appears it is not available.
keyboardSelect.permissionError: Your computer won't let Chrysalis talk to your keyboard. (You do not have read/write permissions to {{path}}.)
keyboardSelect.permissionErrorSuggestion: Chrysalis can fix this by installing a udev rules file into /etc/udev/rules.d/.

firmwareUpdate.bootloaderWarning: Your keyboard is in bootloader mode, so Chrysalis can't back up the keyboard's settings. If the new firmware is incompatible with your existing settings, key layouts and other settings might be corrupted after the update. For this reason, Chrysalis will default to a factory reset, which will let you start from a clean slate. You can cancel and exit bootloader mode, so Chrysalis can back up your keyboard. Alternatively, you may turn off the factory reset, if you know that the new firmware is compatible.

bootloaderConnectDialog.title: Connecting to your keyboard...
bootloaderConnectDialog.contents: Next up, we need to connect to your keyboard's bootloader. After you click the button below, select your keyboard from the list of devices shown by your browser.

firmwareUpdate.factoryResetDescription: Erase everything on your keyboard, restoring it to factory defaults.
firmwareUpdate.factoryResetWarning: Selecting this option will not backup your current layout or settings.

notifications.title: Problem encountered while flashing

enter.stillApplication: The keyboard has not entered programmable mode yet. Please make sure to follow the instructions below.
enter.notFound: Unable to find the keyboard. Please file an issue.

reconnect.stillBootloader: The keyboard is still in programmable mode. Please release any keys you may be holding.
reconnect.notFound: Unable to find the keyboard. Please file an issue.

notifications.unknownMessage: Unknown message received during flashing: {{ message }}

confirmDialog.title: Are you sure you want to update the firmware?
confirmDialog.description: Installing new firmware will replace the existing one on the device. Once the new firmware is installed, Chrysalis will take you back to the keyboard selection screen.

factoryConfirmDialog.title: Replace the firmware and reset to factory defaults?
factoryConfirmDialog.contents: This will replace the firmware on the device, and reset all settings to factory defaults. You will lose all customizations made. Once the new firmware is installed, Chrysalis will take you back to the keyboard selection screen.

reconnectDialog.title: Reconnect to your keyboard
reconnectDialog.contents: Chrysalis needs to reconnect to your keyboard. After you click the button below, select your keyboard from the list of devices shown by your browser.

firmwareUpdate.customFirmwareExplanation: You can install firmware build you've downloaded or built locally.
firmwareUpdate.description: Updating your keyboard's firmware is how we teach it new tricks. You can use Chrysalis to install the latest firmware for your keyboard or to install firmware you've built yourself.

focus-not-detected.title: Welcome to Chrysalis
focus-not-detected.contents: Chrysalis recognizes your keyboard, but needs to update its firmware before you can continue.
focus-not-detected.reconnectDescription: There's a possibility that we misdetected the capabilities of the keyboard, or that the keyboard was starting up while we connected. In this case, you can try clicking the "{{buttonName}}" button to attempt a reconnect, and look for the necessary features again. Reconnecting is useful if you're sure there was a temporary failure upon previous attempts, and the problem has been resolved.

systeminfo.title: Report a problem
systeminfo.intro: If you're having trouble with Chrysalis, the development team may ask you to send them some debugging information. Chrysalis can help you collect and package up everything you might need to share. This includes error logs, as well as a bit of information about this computer's operating system, connected devices, and Chrysalis itself. Keyboard information will include information about the keyboard's current firmware, as well as key layouts and LED configuration.
systeminfo.bugTracker: You can find a list of known issues (or report a bug) on GitHub
systeminfo.privacyNote: We try hard not to include private information in this bundle, but recommend you read through it before sharing it.

Splitography.updateInstructions:
After clicking the Continue button, reset your keyboard (by pressing the small
reset button beside the USB port) to put it into programmable mode, within ten
seconds.

Atreus.updateInstructions: Hold down the key in the bottom left corner of the keyboard (in the default layout, this key is the ESC key). Continue holding it down while you click the Continue button.

Model01.updateInstructions: Hold down the key in the top left corner of the keyboard (in the default layout, this key is the PROG key). Continue holding it while you click the Continue button. Once the keys start flashing red across the board, you can release the key.

Model100.updateInstructions: Hold down the key in the top left corner of the keyboard (in the default layout, this key is the PROG key). Continue holding it while you click the Continue button. Once the keys start flashing green across the first column of the board, please release the key, as holding it too long may prevent flashing from succeeding.
